paper_abstract:
We consider the problem of estimating the latent structure of a social
network based on observational data on information diffusion processes, or {\it
cascades}. Here for a given cascade, we only observe the time a node/agent is
infected but not the source of infection. Existing literature has focused on
estimating network diffusion matrix without any underlying assumptions on the
structure of the network. We propose a novel model for inferring network
diffusion matrix based on the intuition that an information datum is more
likely to propagate among two nodes if they are interested in similar topics,
which are common with the information. In particular, our model endows each
node with an influence vector (how authoritative they are on each topic) and a
receptivity vector (how susceptible they are on each topic). We show how this
node-topic structure can be estimated from observed cascades. The estimated
model can be used to build recommendation system based on the receptivity
vectors, as well as for marketing based on the influence vectors.
paper_title: An Influence-Receptivity Model for Topic based Information Cascades
